name: BBQ Chicken Kebabs with Basmati Rice and Garden Salad
description: Oven-glazed chicken kebabs with fluffy basmati rice and a crisp lettuce-cucumber-tomato salad. Mild, fast, and family-friendly.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 220°C (425°F). Line a tray with foil and lightly oil it.
Rinse basmati rice in a sieve until water runs clear.
Chop lettuce, slice cucumber, and halve cherry tomatoes; set in a large bowl.
Measure BBQ sauce, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
cook_steps: Place chicken kebabs on the prepared tray. Brush with half the BBQ sauce.
Bake kebabs for 10 minutes, then brush with remaining BBQ sauce and bake 5–8 minutes more until cooked through (juices run clear).

While kebabs bake, add rinsed basmati rice to a pot with water (about 1.5–2 cups water per cup rice) and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then cover, reduce heat to low, and simmer 12 minutes. Turn off heat and rest covered 5 minutes; fluff with a fork.
Toss lettuce, cucumber, and cherry tomatoes with vinaigrette. Season with a pinch of salt and pepper.
Serve kebabs over basmati rice with the salad on the side.
instructions: Preheat oven to 220°C (425°F). Line a tray with foil and lightly oil it.
Rinse basmati rice in a sieve until water runs clear.
Chop lettuce, slice cucumber, and halve cherry tomatoes; set in a large bowl.

Place chicken kebabs on the prepared tray. Brush with half the BBQ sauce.
Bake kebabs for 10 minutes, then brush with remaining BBQ sauce and bake 5–8 minutes more until cooked through (juices run clear).

While kebabs bake, add rinsed basmati rice to a pot with water (about 1.5–2 cups water per cup rice) and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then cover, reduce heat to low, and simmer 12 minutes. Turn off heat and rest covered 5 minutes; fluff with a fork.
Toss lettuce, cucumber, and cherry tomatoes with vinaigrette. Season with a pinch of salt and pepper.
Serve kebabs over basmati rice with the salad on the side.
